headline: Kroger is leveraging prices to close the gap with Walmart
summary: While Kroger (KR) shared mixed second quarter results — revenue of $33.94 billion (slightly below estimates of $34.12 billion), adjusted earnings of $1.04 per share (a notch above estimates of $1.00) — the supermarket chain raised its full-year forecast around grocery demand. Roth Capital Partners senior research analyst Bill Kirk assesses how Kroger is slowly closing the gap between Walmart (WMT). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Kroger Says It’s Taking Tariff Hits for Grocery Shoppers
summary: Kroger executives say the Cincinnati-based supermarket chain is trying to hold the line on passing along price increases to shoppers, which has included shouldering tariff-related costs. Some food makers and restaurants say they’re raising prices in response to tariffs, plus higher meat and coffee costs.

raw.headline: Kroger Says It’s Taking Tariff Hits for Grocery Shoppers
raw.summary: Kroger executives say the Cincinnati-based supermarket chain is trying to hold the line on passing along price increases to shoppers, which has included shouldering tariff-related costs. Some food makers and restaurants say they’re raising prices in response to tariffs, plus higher meat and coffee costs.

summary: The grocery chain is conducting a “full site-by-site analysis” and leaning on its stores to fill orders as it looks to improve profitability and reduce costs, interim CEO Ron Sargent said.

headline: Kroger: Fiscal Q2 Earnings Snapshot
summary: CINCINNATI (AP) — Kroger Co. (KR) on Thursday reported fiscal second-quarter profit of $609 million. The Cincinnati-based company said it had profit of 91 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, were $1.04 per share.

raw.headline: Kroger: Fiscal Q2 Earnings Snapshot

headline: Kroger raises annual sales forecast as Americans stick to eating at home
summary: Kroger on Thursday raised its annual core sales forecast for the second straight time, banking on resilient demand for fresh produce and other essentials from cautious Americans cutting back on eating out.  The company has focused on promotions and maintaining low prices to meet rising customer demand for value.  On Thursday, Kroger said it had lowered prices on more than 3,500 products this year, up from the more than 2,000 it disclosed in June.

raw.headline: Kroger raises annual sales forecast as Americans stick to eating at home
raw.summary: Kroger on Thursday raised its annual core sales forecast for the second straight time, banking on resilient demand for fresh produce and other essentials from cautious Americans cutting back on eating out.  The company has focused on promotions and maintaining low prices to meet rising customer demand for value.  On Thursday, Kroger said it had lowered prices on more than 3,500 products this year, up from the more than 2,000 it disclosed in June.
